keyHighlights: Top performing post is an image with 21 likes showcasing high visual engagement.

executiveSummary.summaryText: This report provides a detailed analysis of Bill Douglas's LinkedIn performance over the report period. It covers content type distribution, audience engagement, posting patterns, and a comparison against key industry influencers. The insights are data-driven, aiming to improve digital content strategy and audience interaction. Strategic recommendations are provided to enhance overall engagement and content efficacy.

contentAnalysis.visualImpactInsight: Image posts (avg engagement: 3) tend to perform as well as text posts, indicating the potential for improvement through enhanced visuals.
contentAnalysis.postTypeDistributionInsight: Image posts are most common at 51.52% of posts, followed by text posts at 41.67%, suggesting the audience prefers visual content.

influencers.name: Ali Ghodsi
influencers.title: CEO & Co-Founder at Databricks, Adjunct Professor at UC Berkeley
influencers.descriptionFocus: CEO & Co-Founder leading breakthroughs in distributed systems, big data and AI. His posts and insights blend technical excellence with strategic vision.

profile.name: Ali Ghodsi
profile.title: CEO & Co-Founder at Databricks, Adjunct Professor at UC Berkeley

post.text:
In just two weeks, we revolutionized Dolly. Introducing the first open source, instruction-following LLM, fine-tuned on a human-generated instruction dataset licensed for commercial use. 

With Dolly 2.0, any organization can create, own, and customize a powerful LLM without sharing their proprietary data with 3rd parties or paying for API access. The model uses a new dataset, “databricks-dolly-15k,” which is made up of more than 15,000 records generated by thousands of Databricks employees. It’s the first open source, human-generated instruction dataset specifically designed to make LLMs exhibit the magical interactivity of ChatGPT (instruction following). 

We’re open-sourcing the entirety of Dolly 2.0, including the training code, dataset, and model weights, all suitable for commercial use.

https://bit.ly/43oXmsy 

#llm #dolly #lakehouse #databricks

influencers.name: Bill Schmarzo
influencers.title: Dean of Big Data, CDO Chief AI Officer Whisperer, recognized global innovator, educator, and practitioner in Big Data, Data Science, & Design Thinking
influencers.descriptionFocus: Thought leader in digital transformation and data monetization with a business-first approach. Shares actionable strategies that resonate with enterprise technology and revenue optimization.

profile.name: Bill Schmarzo
profile.title: Dean of Big Data, CDO Chief AI Officer Whisperer, recognized global innovator, educator, and practitioner in Big Data, Data Science, & Design Thinking

post.text:
So, let me ask a stupid question (my specialty): If our existing large language models (LLMs) have already soaked up most of the world's information, why are we trying to update them with synthetic information, which will likely dilute the accuracy and relevance of the actual information already in the LLM?

Instead, shouldn't we teach organizations and individuals how to use RAG and  Contextual Continuity techniques to massage these LLMs to yield more relevant and accurate responses?

If LLMs have reached the law of diminishing returns (and maybe they should just be turned into a public utility for the benefit of all), then let's invest in the people skills and tools to get more value from these marvelous LLM creations.

Prof. Ahmed Banafa Chris Surdak Mark Stouse John Thompson Dan Everett Jon Cooke Malcolm Hawker Dell Technologies Navin Mukraj Cindi Howson Jeff Frick Kyle Winterbottom Renée B. Lahti Kevin Petrie Eddie Short

#AI #LLM #GenAI #RAG #ContextualContinuity #DataScience #ValueEngineering

influencers.name: Barr Moses
influencers.title: Co-Founder & CEO at Monte Carlo
influencers.descriptionFocus: CEO and co-founder of a leading data + AI observability platform that ensures data reliability for enterprise operations. Regularly shares insights on building robust, reliable digital infrastructures.

post.text:
Who owns data quality? 

It’s a question as old as Oracle Version 3, and the answer varies depending on who you ask.

- Some organizations like to spread the responsibility around to multiple team members, each responsible for a few pipelines. 

- Others prefer to concentrate the responsibility on a select few specialists who have a holistic view of the entire platform. 

- And then there are those who view data quality as a technical issue, while others see it as a business or process problem.

But at the end of the day, the only thing that matters is that it gets done. 

Shane Murray and I have spoken to thousands of data leaders over the years to understand the most common ownership models for data quality, and how data teams can apply them at scale.

From data engineering to data governance teams, our latest explores the pros and cons of each approach: https://lnkd.in/eiUPWypC

(Meme inspired by Chad Sanderson)

#dataquality #dataengineering #datareliability

influencers.name: Willem Pienaar
influencers.title: AI & Infra
influencers.descriptionFocus: Creator of Feast, Willem focuses on building AI tools and nurturing open source communities. His work on AI infrastructure aligns with digital transformation and innovative connectivity—a key theme for transformative CRE strategies.

post.text:
It’s finally time to share what we’ve been up to.

We’re building Cleric, an autonomous AI SRE, to free software engineers up from on-call support.

Engineering teams of the future will be combination of AI agents and humans. The sprawl and complexity of production environments is no place for the best engineers to sink their time.

Cleric is an AI teammate that can quickly and reliably diagnose issues in production environments, from critical downtimes to the long tail of issues in your backlog. It understands your processes, knows how to use your tools and APIs, reasons through novel situations it wasn’t trained on, learns from each incident, and never sleeps.

Investigations that previously took days, now take minutes.

We’ve raised a seed of $4.3m led by Zetta Venture Partners and a set of AI, infrastructure, and security angels and advisors. 

If you’d like to try Cleric out, or help us build it, reach out!

James Alcorn Jocelyn Goldfein Mark Gorenberg Zak K. Kesavan Nair (Kay) Saro Subbiah Michael Del Balso Kevin Stumpf Olivier Bonnet Sanjeev Sisodiya Ashish Thusoo Pete Soderling Demetrios Brinkmann (is at Kubecon) Ian Swanson Bhawna Singh Ian Livingstone Tahir Hashmi Timo Kuschma Shomik Ghosh Chip Huyen (at GTC/GDC) Eugene Yan

summaryOfComparison: The client exhibits lower engagement and posting frequency compared to top influencers such as Ali Ghodsi and Barr Moses. Emphasizing visual content and a more consistent posting schedule could help bridge the gap and elevate overall engagement.

gapAnalysis.recommendedAction: Increase interactive content and leverage high-engagement formats.
Adopt a more consistent posting schedule to boost visibility.

recommendations.contentStrategy: Diversify content by integrating more visual posts and articles to highlight industry insights.
recommendations.visualElements: Increase the use of high-quality images and infographics to capture audience attention.
recommendations.postingSchedule: Adopt a consistent posting schedule, especially on Tuesdays when engagement is highest.
recommendations.audienceTargeting: Focus on key industry sectors such as Technology and Marketing to enhance engagement.
recommendations.engagementTactics: Incorporate interactive elements like polls and Q&A sessions to foster audience interaction.
